text: In the hush between heartbeats, the runes listen.
Steel wins battles; stories win kingdoms.
A single candle can shame a cathedral of darkness.
The forest remembers every oath you break beneath its boughs.
Magic is never free—only patient.
I have seen heroes fall to pride, and cowards rise to purpose.
When the moon is thin, even whispers carry blades.
Name a thing truly, and it will either bow—or bite.
The old roads are kinder to those who travel with humble pockets and sharp eyes.
Every spell is a door; every door asks what you are willing to leave behind.
Do not fear the storm—fear the silence that follows it.
A crown is only a circle of metal until someone bleeds for it.
In the guttering light, even angels cast uncertain shadows.
The dead are patient teachers; they repeat their lessons until you listen.
The first law of sorcery: what you desire will desire something from you.
Trust the map, but trust your footsteps more.
A friend at your back is worth more than a prophecy in your hand.
We carved our fate into stone—then taught the stone to sing.
Beware the kindly wizard; kindness is sometimes a leash.
Tonight, the stars look like punctures in the veil of a watching god.
